item.title: There was a significant increase in early-stage M&A activity in the APAC region during the fourth quarter of 2016
item.description:
The Intralinks Deal Flow Predictor, which forecasts future merger and acquisition (M&A) announcements, anticipates a 6% rise in the total number of global M&A deals announced in the first half of 2017 compared to the same period in 2016. This would establish a new record for global announced deals in the first six months of a year. The Asia Pacific (APAC) region leads in early-stage M&A activity, demonstrating 44% year-over-year growth in the fourth quarter of 2016, and is positioned to significantly contribute to the projected record deal count in the first half of 2017...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/there-was-a-significant-increase-in-early-stage-m-a-activity-in-the-apac-region-during-the-fourth-quarter-of-2016/

item.title: Intralinks APAC respondents predict that waves in China will have an impact on M&A
item.description:
Dealmakers in the Asia Pacific (APAC) region believe that China’s economic and market activity will be the biggest influence on mergers and acquisitions (M&A) in the region over the coming six months. This insight comes from a survey of over 1,600 global M&A professionals conducted by Intralinks, a leading provider of M&A deal management and secure collaboration solutions. The survey, conducted between October 4 and 11, 2016, gathered responses from dealmakers across APAC, Europe, the Middle East and Africa, North America, and Latin America...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/intralinks-apac-respondents-predict-that-waves-in-china-will-have-an-impact-on-m-a/
